newsitem.title: CHINA: Shanghai B shares end down on weak sentiment.
newsitem.headline: Shanghai B shares end down on weak sentiment.

text.p: The Shanghai B share index ended down slightly on Friday on weak sentiment, dampened by Thursday's sharp falls and fears of further crackdown measures in the short term, brokers said.
The B index fell 0.196 points or 0.24 percent to 82.387 points on volume of 21.332 million shares worth $16.194 million.

With Beijing imposing new curbs on the trading of shares by the state-owned enterprises, barring them from making "speculative" deals, investors are eager to offset their positions, which hurt sentiment, brokers said.
"Institutions are not willing to build positions under such unfavourable conditions, because more clampdown news is expected in the near-term," one broker said.

"The index will consolidate at current levels early next week after the recent falls if there is no further crackdown news," another broker said. "Otherwise the market will break down below 80 points with 75 points the next likely support."
Of 43 B shares, 40 traded, with 14 down, eight flat and 18 up.
Shanghai Rubber Belt was the biggest loser on poor prospects, plunging $0.020 or 8.84 percent to $0.206 on volume of 50,000 shares.
Inner Mongolia Erdos Cashmere was the most actively traded with its 100 million new shares listed today, slipping $0.060 or 6.55 percent to $0.856 on volume of 5.3 million shares.
Shanghai's A share index staged a technical rebound thanks to some institutional support for stocks with a heavy index weighting, but market sentiment was still weak, broker said.
The index gained 20.514 points or 1.59 percent to 1,310.627 points on volume of 497.3 million shares worth 7.5 billion yuan.
The SSE30 blue chip index closed up 107.946 points or 2.86 percent to 3,881.928 points.
Beijing Double Crane Pharmaceutical 600062.SS was the biggest winner on bargain-hunting, soaring 1.38 yuan or 9.96 percent to 15.23 yuan on volume of 15.8 million shares.
